com.robotgame.gameengine.Match

Class Match

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.robotgame.gameengine.Match.Match
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Match
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Represents one game. Is run by a class implementing IMatchHandler that provides a function to call when the match is over.

    After the match has been created it has to be populated by robots using the method BuildRobots() that accepts a vector of RobotBlueprint objects as argument. When the robots are built the match can be started by calling the method run(). When the match is over it will call the method MatchEnded() in match handler. A Match object has the following update cycle:

    1. Create MatchContext object containing all information relevant to sensor nodes.

    2. Update nodes of every robot.

    3. Perform the actions created by the nodes of each robot.

    4. Update the states of every robot, applying the impulses generated by the actions in the previous step.

    5. Create a MatchState object containing all information needed by the clients.

    6. Send the match state to the clients via the match handler.

    7. Check if match has ended, if so call the MatchEnded() in match handler.

    8. Advance the game clock.

    Todo: Add projectile system.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Match

        public Match(IMatchHandler matchHandler,
     int matchId)
        Match objects should be created in a class implementing IMatchHandler. That object should pass itself as the matchHandler argument. A typical Match object is created by a match handler as: Match match = new Match(this, 0);
        Parameters:
        matchHandler - a handler capable of communicating network data with players
        matchId - a unique identifying number for the game. May be used as unique key in a future statistics database.

    • Method Detail

      • BuildRobots

        public boolean BuildRobots(java.util.Vector<RobotBlueprint> blueprints)
        Needs to be called before run() is called.
        Parameters:
        blueprints - The blueprints of the robots to participate in the game.
        Returns:
        whether the robots were successfully built.

      • SetRunning

        public void SetRunning(boolean v)

      • start

        public void start()

      • run

        public void run()
        Starts and runs the match. It will not work unless BuildRobots() has been called successfully. _matchHandler.MatchEnded() will be called when the match is over.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
